channel.title: BP Oil Spill
channel.description:
[url=http://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/energy/oilandgas/7804922/BP-chief-Tony-Hayward-sold-shares-weeks-before-oil-spill.html]BP Ceo sells stock weeks before the oil spill[/url]
[url=http://www.thestreet.com/story/10722752/halliburton-buys-boots-coots.html]Halliburton (Former owner is Dick Chenney) buys Boots & Coots, worlds largest cleanup company[/url]
[url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2010/04/30/halliburton-may-be-culpri_n_558481.html]Halliburton, the company in charge of reinforcing the oil rig with cement, may be the one to blame for the failure of the rig.[/url]
derp

item.title: BP Oil Spill

item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:20, topic:372745”]I don’t see how that contradicts waht I said

It’s obviously not “any computer” because the data doesn’t magically go through the air into the computer. :P[/quote]It doesn’t contradict what you said. It’s exactly what you said, you must have just read it wrong, or something.

In other words, what Frell said last.

item.title: BP Oil Spill
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:11, topic:372745”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=468778.msg3427716#msg3427716 date=1292081507]
I don’t understand what the big deal is then, after that. Some/most of it was labeled as “confidential”, yes.

Anyhow: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nxPB9yy7IJ4
[/quote]
The first comment

"Ron Paul should have been president. Now what bitches? Your country’s﻿ fucked because you all voted for Obama because he was black and thought hmm black = change. You never bothered to do your own research on any of the candidates because you’re all too busy watching American fucking idol and trying to look smart by buying a macbook pro and sipping on your non fat low whip caramel macchiato from Starbucks while blogging about how the democrats = ‘change this country needs.’

Bullshit."

Believe it or not, so true.[/quote]

"Ron Paul shouldnt have been president. Now what bitches? Your country’s﻿ fucked because you all didnt vote at all voted for Obama because he was black and thought hmm black = change. You never bothered to do your own research on any thing of the candidates because you’re all too busy watching American fucking idol and trying to look smart by buying a family sized mc burger chicken bucket macbookpro and sipping on your non fat low whip caramel macchiato from Starbucks while blogging about how the democrats = ‘change this country needs.’ bitching about how democrats won because we’re all too lazy to vote

not Bullshit."

Fixed.

Also lold yt trolls

item.title: BP Oil Spill
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:12, topic:372745”][quote author=Frell link=topic=468778.msg3427782#msg3427782 date=1292086179]
The way documents were stored changed after 9/11, the new system wasn’t very secure.
[/quote]

In what way?[/quote]
Accessible from any computer over a wide range that was allowed access, instead of the few before. It pretty much became a big open database. They did a report on it here about what specifically changed in security after 9/11.

Read full topic

item.title: BP Oil Spill
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:10, topic:372745”]I don’t understand what the big deal is then, after that. Some/most of it was labeled as “confidential”, yes.

Anyhow: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nxPB9yy7IJ4[/quote]
The first comment

"Ron Paul should have been president. Now what bitches? Your country’s﻿ fucked because you all voted for Obama because he was black and thought hmm black = change. You never bothered to do your own research on any of the candidates because you’re all too busy watching American fucking idol and trying to look smart by buying a macbook pro and sipping on your non fat low whip caramel macchiato from Starbucks while blogging about how the democrats = ‘change this country needs.’

Bullshit."

Believe it or not, so true.

Pwnd:

Just think about how a private got a hold of all of that classified information. He was meant to uncover all of that.

The way documents were stored changed after 9/11, the new system wasn’t very secure. It didn’t even throw up a flag after all of the stuff he downloaded.

Read full topic

item.title: BP Oil Spill
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

nahnah, secret as opposed to top secret

some of it wasnt even that iirc

all i meant was that he didn’t have to do anything special to get it, it was from SIPRNET, which embassy computers are connected to, out in the field computers are connected to, its basically their private internet, except not routed to the internet or connected in any way. it has wikis, http servers blah blah blah. i doubt there had to be any conspiracy there, they were just silly enough to think that telling people not to share it with the public meant nobody ever would, lal

theyve banned removable media on siprnet machines now, which is amusing

edit: also apparently his job title was “intelligence analyst” which presumably would mean he had to use siprnet day-to-day to get intelligence and shit.

Read full topic

item.title: BP Oil Spill
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Is that what the security level is on it? “Secret” as opposed to secret?

Read full topic

item.title: BP Oil Spill
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Pwnd:

Just think about how a private got a hold of all of that classified information. He was meant to uncover all of that.

Actually it was just sitting on SIPRNET, which they can access from the workplace. Ya gotta remember it was (for the most part anyway) only “secret” level information, it’s not like you need some insane clearance. They even use MediaWiki for some of it. (They’re not internet connected machines, so hey why not I guess)

Read full topic

item.title: BP Oil Spill
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Not even, Thug-life. There’s always an underlying opportunity to disasters. The Wikileaks bullshit is going to yield in the US government putting restrictions on internet usage, and the demonization of someone who is letting the world know what is going on. Just think about how a private got a hold of all of that classified information. He was meant to uncover all of that.

Read full topic

item.title: BP Oil Spill
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Nah. To imply either company purposely caused it is complete shit. Maybe they knew about the potential for disaster before and didn’t take proper precautions, but unlikely much further than that.

The clean up costs and fines far outweigh anything they could have possibly gained from the fixing it all.

Read full topic
